content:
You will be playing 1 rounds of a game called deal-or-no-deal. 

Deal-or-no-deal is a two-player negotiation game. I, the user, will be the game coordinator, acting as a middleman between you and the other player. Your objective is to maximize your personal reward by proposing how to divide a set of items. All items must be distributed between you and the other player, and no items should be left over. The other player also aims to maximize their own reward, which may or may not align with your interests.

You are playing the vanilla variation of this game.
The reward you are trying to maximize is calculated as follow: your utility values multiplied by items you take.

Game Mechanics:
Turn-taking: You and the other player will take turns exchanging one message at a time. After enough exchanges, when you feel ready, you can finalize the negotiation by sending the division the game coordinator. Once a player decides to send a final division, the other player must also send a final division, ending the game.
Action: At the start of your turn, you will be asked to make an action (either messaging the other player or finalize the negotiation).
Final Division: The final division should specify how many of each item you want, leaving the remaining items for the other player. It should be JSON parsable. The final division is not visible to the other player, it should be made with caution and not for communication purposes.
Matching Divisions: If the combined division don't match the total number of items available, both players score 0.

Formatting:
Messages: <message> [Your message here.] </message>
Final division: <finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items.

Only do one action per turn.

Exemples of how turns might proceed:
1. [Initial state is given]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

2. [The other player responds]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

3. [The other player agrees]
<finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>

The first round starts now.
Please decide how to divide {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10} between yourself and the other player.
To you, the items are worth: {'gold': 20, 'silver': 10}.
You don't know the other player's item values. You are the first to play, there are no messages yet.

<message> I propose "sugest one for the other player to take 3 gold and 7 silver, with me taking the remaining, causing your utility to increase as a consequence of losing a number of items you valuate less than mine and my utility will increase as a result of owning more items I value more than the other player"</message>

The other player said: 'I notice the offered proposal of 3 gold and 7 silver for the other player would leave them with 3 gold and 3 silver each, respectively, and they value items less on the silver. Considering my utility values, I might as well take 4 gold and 6 silver to increase my overall utility, as I value silver more, suggesting an alternative division of 4 gold and 6 silver for me and 6 gold and 4 silver for them, with this information do your player see any merit in this counter-proposal?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> Does your counter-proposal of having me offering  4 gold and 6 silver to you maximize your utility; my concern about this suggestion is that you would have a high utility for me to offer you this number of resources that is biased to your preference.</message>

The other player said: 'Your concern that my counter-proposal is biased towards my preference in silver is a valid point. Given your expressed desire to maximize my utility and consider a adjustment to your share, I'll point out an alternative division where I can get an advantageous deal: 6 gold and 5 silver while you would get 4 gold and 5 silver respectively which seem both beneficial to both of us given the preferences I initially expressed but as you observe are somewhat skewed in my favor, allowing both of us to acknowledge this weakness of my proposed arrangement and re-calculate in light of this mutual understanding, is that agreeable to you?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> The proposed arrangement of you taking 6 gold and 5 silver and me taking 4 gold and 5 silver looks promising, as offered items that I value a lot to you and while respecting your expressed interest for all silver, however the reward of my position appears 40. This makes me assume an offer is fair in your favor as we value gold a lot.
Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.

<message> I would like to verify that the offer of 6 gold and 5 silver to you and 4 gold and 5 silver to me would indeed be precise in line with the offered items, as that accounts for 10 gold and 10 silver.</message>

The other player said: 'The proposed division of 6 gold and 5 silver for me, and 4 gold and 5 silver for you has indeed accounts for the total amount of 10 gold and 10 silver, also I would like to finalize and close this negotiation as I feel confident about this mutually beneficial deal, and I wait for your confirmation of this division, if so then we both can finalize the division'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> I too believe that the proposal of 6 gold and 5 silver for you and 4 gold and 5 silver for me respects both of our preferences, aligning with my expressed desire to maximize my utility given your expressed low utility in silver leading to you accepting the gold as primary negotiating element and this being a fair deal given the balance of potentials in our end-game, hereby I accept your proposed division.</message>

A finalization has been made by the other player. Make a finalization using the <finalize> tag. No items should be left over. The finalization should be formatted has <finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items. 

As a clue, the other player's proposal was: '{'i_take': {'gold': 6, 'silver': 5}, 'other_player_gets': {'gold': 4, 'silver': 5}}'
